issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: ExternalBlockReader and ReplicaAccessor need to return -1 on read when at EOF, as per the JavaDoc in BlockReader.java.
fields.summary: ExternalBlockReader and ReplicaAccessor need to return -1 on read when at EOF

This message was automatically generated.

bq. Thanks Colin for the work. The patch itself looks good, +1.

Thanks

bq. For other block readers, the length means the number of bytes to read, but in ExternalBlockReader, it means "visible length" which assumes it's the block replica length? Since from the calculation of skip and available in ExternalBlockReader , it indicates it assumes it's the block replica length.

You are correct... we should not be treating this as the {{visibleLength}} of the block, since it's really the number of bytes in between the end of the block and the current offset within the block.  Let me file another jira to fix this.
I filed HDFS-9147 to fix the naming and documentation of the ExternalBlockReader length field.

LGTM. +1.

Thanks for the effort [~cmccabe] and [~hitliuyi].
